docs.summary: Adjusts the point balance of a loyalty account.
description:
The `adjustPoints()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the updated loyalty account.

To adjust the points balance of an account you must include an `accountId`, a `revision` number, and the adjustment to make. You can also leave a description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

There are two ways to adjust the points of a loyalty account:
- `balance` allows you to set the total points balance to this new amount.
- `amount` allows you to alter the points balance by this amount. This amount can be a positive number to increase the points balance or a negative number to decrease the balance.

>**Note:** Only visitors with **Manage Loyalty** [permissions](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Froles-and-permissions) can create loyalty accounts.

examples.title: Adjust loyalty account balance
body: // Sample description value: 'Sync from external program'
export async function myAdjustPointsFunction(identifiers, description, amount) {
const updatedAccount = await account.adjustPoints(identifiers, description, amount);
console.log('Success! New account balance is: ', updatedBalance, '. This ID for this transaction is: ', transactionId);

params.name: contactId
params.doc:
Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to
[learn more about a site's contacts](/wix-crm-backend/contacts).

docs.summary: Creates a loyalty account for one of a site's contacts.
description:
The `createAccount()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the new loyalty account when it is created.

To create a new loyalty account, the customer must first be a site contact with a contact ID. See [contacts](wix-crm-backend/contacts) to learn more about a site's contacts. The site must also have an active loyalty program before loyalty accounts can be created. See the [`activateLoyaltyProgram()`](wix-loyalty-backend/program/activateloyaltyprogram) function to activate a site's loyalty program.

>**Note:** Only visitors with **Manage Loyalty** [permissions](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Froles-and-permissions) can create loyalty accounts.

examples.title: Create a loyalty account for a site contact
body: console.log('Success! The account ID for this new loyalty account is: ', accountId);

docs.summary: Adds points to a loyalty account.
description:
The `earnPoints()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the updated loyalty account.

Points are earned manually, through a function you add to the Velo code, or through an automatic event. If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Wix Loyalty Program's `wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. For reference, see the code example: **Loyalty account earns points for subscribing to your newsletter**. If points were earned in an automatic event, then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

Only a positive amount can be added using the `earnPoints()` function. To adjust an account's balance for a negative amount, use [`adjustPoints()`](/wix-loyalty-backend/accounts/adjustpoints).

>**Note:** Only visitors with **Manage Loyalty** [permissions](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Froles-and-permissions) can create loyalty accounts.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

docs.summary: Gets an account using the loyalty account ID.
description:
The `getAccount()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the specified loyalty account when it is retrieved.

You can also get an account using a secondary ID, such as a contact ID or a member ID with the [`getAccountBySecondaryId()`](wix-loyalty-backend/account/getaccountbysecondaryid) function.

examples.title: Get a loyalty account
body: console.log('Success! Current points balance for this account is: ', currentBalance, ' and there is a reward available: ', canGetReward);

docs.summary: Gets the loyalty account of the specified site contact or member.
description:
The `getAccountBySecondaryId()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the specified loyalty account when it is retrieved.

This function gets a loyalty account using a customer's contact ID or member ID. You can also get an account using the loyalty account ID with the [`getAccount()`](wix-loyalty-backend/account/getaccount) function.

examples.title: Get a loyalty account using a contact ID
body: console.log("Success! This site contact's loyalty account Id is: ", accountId);

docs.summary: Gets the total amount of points earned, redeemed, and adjusted for the entire loyalty program.
description:
The `getProgramTotals()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the combined total points for all loyalty accounts in the program.

The `balance` is the current total of points outstanding, while hte `earned`, `adjusted`, and `redeemed` amounts are the historically accumulated amounts. The totals include the amounts for all loyalty accounts.

>**Note:** Only visitors with **Manage Loyalty** [permissions](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Froles-and-permissions) can get program totals.

examples.title: Get the total points for the entire loyalty program
body: console.log('Success! ', redeemed, ' total points have been redeemed in the life of this program.');

docs.summary: Gets a transaction using the transaction ID.
description:
The `getTransaction()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a loyalty transaction when the specified transaction is retrieved.

Loyalty transactions include activity that changes a loyalty account point balance, such as adjusting, earning, or redeeming loyalty points. If you want to get many, or all, of the transactions for a specific loyalty account, use the [`listTransactions()`](wix-loyalty-backend/account/listtransactions) function.

examples.title: Get a transaction
body: console.log('Success! That transaction was created on ', transactionDate, ' and is a ', transactionType, ' type.');

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of loyalty accounts, given the provided filters.
description:
The `listAccounts()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of loyalty accounts when the filtered accounts are retrieved.

You can get selected accounts with an array of `contactIds` or leave that request parameter empty to retrieve a list of all of your site's loyalty accounts.

Use `cursorPaging` to limit how many items load at a time.

>**Note:** Only visitors with **Manage Loyalty** [permissions](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Froles-and-permissions) can retrieve the information for all of a site's loyalty accounts.

examples.title: Get a list of loyalty accounts, limited to 3 accounts
body: console.log('Success! The ID and point balance for the first account in your list is: ', firstAccountId, 'and ', firstAccountBalance);

examples.title: Get a list of specific loyalty accounts using their account IDs
body: console.log('Success! The ID and point balance for the first account in your list is: ', firstAccountId, 'and ', firstAccountBalance);

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of transactions for a specified loyalty account.
description:
The `listTransactions()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of loyalty transactions for the loyalty account specified by the account ID.

Loyalty transactions include activity that changes a loyalty account point balance, such as adjusting, earning, or redeeming loyalty points. If you want to get a specific transaction use the [`getTransaction()`](wix-loyalty-backend/account/gettransaction) function.

examples.title: Get a list of transactions for a loyalty account
body: console.log('The most recent transaction ID is: ', firstId);

members.doc: Merged account.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9,999,999`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999,999,999`

members.name: description
members.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: appId
members.doc:

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

will be removed on September 30, 2022.

Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the loyalty account is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty account.

Ignored when creating an account.

members.doc: Whether the account has a reward available. `true` if the amount of points in `points.balance` are enough to redeem for a reward.

description:
A loyalty account stores a customer's loyalty points balance. A site's customers can earn points to their account
and redeem those points for rewards.

members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Current point balance.

Equal to the sum of `earned` and `adjusted` points, minus `redeemed` points.

Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.

members.name: revision

Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.

description: Will be published when a subscription has a pending change

members.name: originSubscription
members.doc: The subscription  state before the transfer

members.name: targetSubscription
members.doc: The subscription state after the transfer

description:
Will be published when a subscription is transferred between accounts
Holds the state of the same subscription before and after the transfer
subscription ID is the same in both states

members.name: previousMetaSiteId
members.doc: meta site identity that the subscription was previously assigned to

members.name: subscription
members.doc: The subscription

members.name: unassignReason
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'REPLACED_BY_ANOTHER_SUBSCRIPTION'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'USER_REQUESTED'`

description: Will be published when a subscription is unassigned from a meta site

members.name: _id
members.doc: If None, Account belongs to base Tier

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date when the last time Tier was recalculated

members.name: points
members.doc: Points for Tier period (eg. Rolling period for x months). This is equal to the sum of earned and adjusted points for the last x months.

members.name: _id
members.doc: If None, Account belongs to base Tier

members.name: numberOfAccounts
members.doc: Total number of loyalty accounts, that belongs to particular Tier

members.name: baseTierDefinition
members.doc: Used to represent base tier

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc: More periods will be supported in future

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACTIVE'`
- `'DISABLED'`
- `'DRAFT'`
- `'PAUSED'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

description: There can be single TiersSettings per site and it's global (i.e. applies to all program's tiers)

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc: More periods will be supported in future

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Points earned, adjusted, or redeemed in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `EARN` or `ADJUST`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: description
members.doc: Transaction description. Only present for automated transactions of `type` `EARN` or `REDEEM`, when set by the site owner in the Business Manager.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [`earnPoints()`](/wix-loyalty-backend/account/earnpoints) function.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](/wix-members-backend/introduction).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc: Additional redeem information. Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc:
__Deprecated.__ For `transaction.rewardId`, use `transaction.redeemInfo.rewardId` instead. This property
will be removed on June 30, 2022.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADJUST'`
- `'EARN'`
- `'GIVE'`
- `'REDEEM'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

description: Loyalty transaction.
